title: [Mobile] Significant changes to code structure. The large, monolithic…
message:
[Mobile] Significant changes to code structure. The large, monolithic LuasTimesFragment class is now one, more generic class called LineFragment. LineFragment is instantiated twice by MainActivity; once for the Red Line and once for the Green Line, initialising specific local variables for each. These Fragments are then placed into a ViewPager and TabLayout.

The use of ViewPager/TabLayout means that TabHost is also finally gone. This also means that tabs are now flickable - a long-requested feature.

Numerous other improvements.

title: [Mobile] Fixed bug where app will sometimes load when no stop is selected and…
message: [Mobile] Fixed bug where app will sometimes load when no stop is selected and the tab is changed. To reproduce: Start the app, select a default stop from the Red Line in Settings, press the Back button, then tap the Green Line tab. A stop forecast attempts to load and returns "Unknown station".

Fixed bug where "Red Line" and "Green Line" tab titles are displayed in English when Gaeilge is selected locale.

title: [Widget] Fixed issue where stop-to-load would reset back to the first in the…
message:
[Widget] Fixed issue where stop-to-load would reset back to the first in the list of selected stops. This was due to reliance on a static int variable which got garbage collected after a nondeterministric length of time. Replaced this variable with a SharedPreferences entry called "indexNextStopToLoad".

Other trivial code cleanups and fixes.

title: [Widget] Changed AppWidgetManager.updateAppWidget() to…
message:
[Widget] Changed AppWidgetManager.updateAppWidget() to partiallyUpdateAppWidget() in order to (hopefully) mitigate the effects of the service being killed, or when the widget is redrawn from, for example, a screen rotation.

[Widget] Changed SharedPreferences.Editor.apply() to commit(), as commit() is synchronous and returns a boolean value to describe if edits were successfully added.

title: Refactored API back to original due to serious reliability issues with the Dublinked API.
message:
Refactored API back to original due to serious reliability issues with the Dublinked API.
In order to improve resiliency of the original API, there is now a feature to choose randomly between multiple API endpoints for a form of client-determined load balancing.

Left in the Dublinked API classes, but will remove in next commit.

title: Mobile: Replaced Handler.postDelayed() with AlarmManager for the notification functionality.
message:
Mobile: Replaced Handler.postDelayed() with AlarmManager for the notification functionality.
Handler.postDelayed() gets put to sleep by the system when the CPU goes into a deep sleep, so
turning the device's screen off makes the notification get indefinitely delayed.

The TableRows in the stop forecast now highlight when tapped.

title: Mobile: Added notification functionality. A user can tap on a tram in the stop forecast and
message:
Mobile: Added notification functionality. A user can tap on a tram in the stop forecast and
schedule a notification when that tram is a certain time away from the stop.

title: Stop forecast now updates whenever the Activity is resumed, such as when…
message:
Stop forecast now updates whenever the Activity is resumed, such as when switching from another app.
This is vitally important to the user experience, as a quick glance may display older times.

title: Fixed: Timer was not cancelled when Activity paused. Could cause excessive
message:
Fixed: Timer was not cancelled when Activity paused. Could cause excessive
server load, network usage and battery drain.
Typo: s/15 seconds/10 seconds/g

title: Mobile: Initial auto-reload work. Fixed bug where Irish language version would
message:
Mobile: Initial auto-reload work. Fixed bug where Irish language version would
crash due to Luas API message change.

title: Patched against Luas API change which broke the red/green status area colour.
message:
Patched against Luas API change which broke the red/green status area colour.
In a nutshell: when service is operating without disruption, the status message
has traditionally been, "All services operating normally". There was always a
chance this would change and it finally did recently, to: "All Services are
operating normally". A small change, but enough to break some stuff. My fix, just
like the initial implementation, is a bit of a hack. I now look to see if the
status message *contains* the string "operating normally". Sigh... it's a shame
they don't provide a boolean "isFullyOperational" API call.

title: Fixed issue where stop forecast would not be displayed in certain locale configurations.
message:
Fixed issue where stop forecast would not be displayed in certain locale configurations.
Specifically, if the locale was anything other than "ga", e.g. "ga_IE", several conditions
would not be met.

message:

message:

message:

message:
